intro: Epidendrum × purpureum, commonly known as the Purple Epidendrum, is a hybrid orchid species native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers, which bloom in clusters on tall, erect stems. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees and deriving moisture and nutrients from the air and rain.
